facts: Fact 1: The League of Legends World Championship originally had two stages: group stage and knockout round.
Fact 2: In the group stage, 4 teams played in a double round-robin format using best-of-one (BO1) matches.
Fact 3: The top 2 teams in each group advanced to the knockout round.
Fact 4: The knockout round was played using best-of-five (BO5) matches.
rules: Rule 1: If a team finishes in the top 2 of its group after the double BO1 cycle, it qualifies for the knockout round.
Rule 2: If a team reaches the knockout round, it must be prepared for BO5 matches.
question: Can a team qualify for the knockout round by finishing top 2 in its group?

facts: Fact 5: The group stage format has been removed and replaced by a Swiss system.
Fact 6: Under the Swiss system, teams must win at least 2 BO1 matches and 1 BO3 series to qualify for the knockout round.
rules: Rule 1: If a team finishes in the top 2 of its group after the double BO1 cycle, it qualifies for the knockout round.
Rule 3: In the new Swiss format, only teams that win at least 2 BO1 and 1 BO3 match qualify for the knockout round.
rounds.question: Can a team now qualify for the knockout round by finishing top 2 in a group?
Can a team qualify for the knockout round by winning 2 BO1 and 1 BO3 matches in the current format?
